category 4 yarns should work nicely notions measuring tape for gauge gauge is important for this pattern the stitch scissors pattern used creates a fabric that is stretchy and darning needle fits an average head size of 18-23 a looser gauge will result in a hat that is larger than this size a tighter gauge will create a smaller hat gauge swatch take a moment to make a gauge swatch and chain 20 and follow main pattern adjust your hook size if necessary 16 sts x 9 row = 4 note measure your swatch while your fabric is un-stretched special stitch - slip_stitch seam hold your edges together while making sure your sts are lined up evenly you ll still have one live loop place that loop on your hook abbreviations starting with your first st working right to left blo back loop only as normal insert your hook through your next st chain chain on both edges wrap your yarn around your hook half_double_crochet half_double_crochet and pull both through both edges and the loop on repeat repeat your hook you ll have one loop on your hook slip_stitch slip_stitch st / sts stitch / stitches *working the next st insert your hook into both edges wrap your yarn around your hook and pull though both edges and the loop on your hook you ll once again have one loop on your hook * repeat * to * for each st across 2 © 2023 wool intentions all rights reserved pattern chain 46 row 1 half_double_crochet in blo in 3rd chain from hook half_double_crochet in blo in each chain across chain 2 turn 44 sts row 2 half_double_crochet in blo in each st across chain 2 turn 44 sts repeat until work measures 18 un-stretched approximately 40-42 row do not cut yarn finishing fold your work in half that so that the beginning row and last row are touching using a slip_stitch seam see special stitch seam these edges together leaving a 15 tail secure and cut your yarn your project is currently inside out and you will be cinching your hat from this end you can try it on at this point if it s too tight take out the seam and add more row if it s too loose remove the seam and remove row until you have the fit you d like but make sure to seam your hat again before moving on to the next step while your project is still inside out weave the tail through each row at this end of your
